conversation.message: That is an excellent question and speaks directly to one of our core philosophies: preparing children to be confident, autonomous learners. We foster independent learning through several key mechanisms. Firstly, our 'Choice Time' is not simply free play; it is structured to allow children to select activities and manage their time, promoting self-regulation. Secondly, our learning centers are equipped with self-correcting materials, allowing children to identify and fix errors without constant adult intervention, building resilience and problem-solving skills. Finally, teachers use guiding questions rather than direct answers, encouraging children to think critically and formulate their own solutions.
